results.title: Crane Island
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Leonard Frost and Raymond Garceau
results.brief_description: A visit to one of the many tiny islands in the St. Lawrence River. Flocks of snow geese and other migratory birds, annually attract hundreds of sportsmen. Accompanies a party of visiting hunters as they bring down a plentiful bag. Shows the daily life of the French Canadian inhabitants who find a hardy but wholesome existence on the island’s bountiful lowland.

results.title: Crane
results.creator_credit: Smith Street Films, Australian Film Commission and Margaret Anne Smith
results.brief_description: Set in the shipping terminal at Glebe Island, Sydney this short film explores the life and emotions of crane-operator Ron Watson (Robert Noble) who is facing a crisis situation both at home and at work. His job is demanding, often requiring shift-work and long hours. His marriage is falling apart because of his obsession with work and yet Ron seems unable to prevent the inevitable. And the job itself is a dangerous one requiring total focus and agility. Ron, like many of his co-workers on the water front, finally is confronted with the stresses around him and is forced to face the grim reality of his situation. Cast also includes Maya Potter, Joseph Petruzzi, Bob Hornery, Nicholas Flanagan. Original music by Colin Watson, Jim Conway with drums by Hanumandas and cinematography by Brendon Young.

results.title: Craig and Steven
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
An exploration of the concept of masculinity. Craig is a ballet student and Steve is an Australian rules footballer. They discuss their views of life.

results.title: Craftsmen young and old
results.brief_description: A screen magazine containing three items: “Man who makes monsters” Dinosaurs, towering reptiles and other prehistoric creatures, all made of concrete by John Kanerva, turn Calgary Park into a primeval zoo; “All the family carves” Visit to the home workshop of Andre Bourgault, famous French-Canadian sculptor, whose children are learning his craft; “Last of the totem makers” Chief Mango Martin and his son preserve in their carving of totem poles, a unique art of Canada’s Pacific coast Indians.

results.title: Craftsmart: christmas special
results.creator_credit: Lennox Television Productions, Kingwest Productions and Phillip Harris
results.brief_description: Great Australian Christmas decoration ideas, with Lena Williams who gives step by step instructions to make low cost, easy and highly decorative handicrafts including a traditional Christmas wreath and an Australian Christmas table setting complete with bread basket, napkins, salt and pepper shakers and an Australian centrepiece and bon bons.

results.title: Crafts of my province = Artisans de nouveau Brunswick [French language]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and Marcel Martin
results.brief_description: A documentary on Canadian artisans from New Brunswick revolving around a sculptress and her husband who is a potter. Shows how they decorate, glaze and fire the pottery and each year open their house as a showroom to lovers of art. We meet their friends who are silversmiths and get inspiration from the sea and rocks and use stones to make jewellery. Also shows wool being dyed and woven into cloth for sale to the USA and overseas.

results.title: Crafts of My Province
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones, Douglas Jackson and Kirk Jones
results.brief_description: A film visit to New Brunswick craftsmen, such as the potters Kjeld and Erica Deichmann of Sussex, N.B., who demonstrate all stages, from potter’s wheel to kiln. Shown also are the hand-looming of woolens and the designing of jewelry from local stones and silver.

results.title: Crafts in Yackandandah
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Kim Montgomery and Csilla Csongvay
results.brief_description: Inspired by the changing landscape, the availability of raw materials and a sense of community, various talented crafts practitioners call Yackandandah home. From internationally recognised potter John Dermer and local weaver Jan Clements, to Christine Thorpe owner of Spiritus Gallery we are introduced to wood carvers, guitar makers and jewellery designers.

results.title: Crafts in Australia
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Australia Council and Stafford Garner
results.brief_description: This is a semi-promotional film made for the Crafts Council of Australia. Shows Australian craftsmen and women and their ideas, motivation and life style. Mirka Mora briefly features.
